subject: Re: [junit] Alternative to repeating @ContextConfiguration
msgSnippet: Interesting idea on forking, no had not considered that, was hoping for an out of the box solution! Since the applicationContext path is hardcoded every time,
messageBody:
Interesting idea on forking, no had not considered that, was hoping for an
out of the box solution!

Since the applicationContext path is hardcoded every time, imho, it's
different from repeating extends MySpringTestCase.


Alistair Israel wrote:
>
> On Fri, Mar 26, 2010 at 7:43 AM, tomjcorcoran <boardtc@...> wrote:
> Have you considered 'forking' SpringJUnit4ClassRunner and essentially
> hard-coding the location of your ContextConfiguration?
>
> I mean, it's not much different from having to repeat "extends
> MySpringTestCase" every time, is it?
>

--
